How can I disable login with the Root User in a Linux system?

To disable login with the Root User, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the SSH configuration file using the command `sudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config`.
2. Find the line `PermitRootLogin yes` and change it to `PermitRootLogin no`.
3. Save the changes and exit the editor.
4. Apply the new settings by restarting the SSH service using the command `sudo systemctl restart sshd`.

Disable login with Root User
(make sure your newly created user login works and has sudo rights)
 `sudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config`
Find: PermitRootLogin yes
And set to
PermitRootLogin no
Apply new settings:
 `sudo systemctl restart sshd`
